Subjective: Sore throat is painful when swallowing.
Sore throat persists despite taking paracetamol and ibuprofen.
Objective: Right ear canal is slightly red.
Right ear canal is otherwise calm.
A few small, non-pathological lymph nodes are palpable in the neck.
There is coating on both tonsils.
No abnormal sounds are audible on auscultation.
Plan: The patient has been informed that the throat infection is likely viral.
The patient has been informed that antibiotics are not necessary in this situation.
Advice to take paracetamol 4 times daily, 1000 mg.
Advice to take ibuprofen 3 times daily, 400 mg.
Advice to drink cold beverages to relieve pain.
Advice to eat ice lollies to relieve pain.
Advice to contact again if symptoms worsen.
Advice to contact again if shortness of breath occurs.
Advice to contact again if swallowing difficulties increase.
